title: Ticket #7829: Hardening of TOKEN support before next stable release
description:
Several misc issues to be addressed before token support in HTCondor goes in production in a stable series:

Issues to resolve

  1. DONE Our JWT parsing code needs a copyright
  2. DONE Tokens with CRLF line endings, or any whitespace at all other than a single newline character, cannot be parsed. Prolly happened with commit [56470].
  3. Daemons will read system tokens with PRIV_CONDOR (see findTokens() in condor_auth_passwd.cpp)... should it use PRIV_ROOT instead?
  4. condor_token_fetch should temporarily set SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION=Required to prevent it from failing in typical configurations, even when a user can successfully authenticate to the schded.
  5. Either get this tested/working on Windows / Mac or document that it is Linux only
  6. Documentation: actual format of a token file sitting in tokens.d is not discussed; for instance, unclear that a single file in tokens.d can contain multiple tokens, or that a token file can have comments, or that a token follows the JWT standard.
  7. Documentation: No SCITOKEN authentication method documentation (why was #7281 resolved?)
  8. Documentation: No documentation for knob TRUST_DOMAIN

Extra Credit

  1. Perhaps it would be really nice if a token entry in a token file could end with a comment (a space followed by a pound-sign then comment)? Like an ssh key? Currently comments are only allowed on their own line.
remarks:
2020-Aug-28 14:57:49 by bbockelm:
For the item about SCITOKEN documentation: this was on purpose because the approach was experimental.

However, I agree now things are in such a place we should get these documented.

2020-Aug-28 15:39:50 by bbockelm:
Note: we gave a user a script to use tokens for remote-submit and failed to tell him to avoid Windows.

He dutifully ran it on Windows and, today, was able to get jobs running!

So, IDTOKENS are at least minimally functional on Windows. I believe Todd has been finding lots of small issues though.
